tool.name: Biomedical Named Entity Recognizer
tool.description: (standalone) Identify bio-medical named entities in unannotated text
tool.help:
**What it does**
Required Annotations --------------------
* None
Generated Annotations ---------------------
* **Protein** annotations in `GATE XML format <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/splitch5.html#x8-1000005.5.2>`_ * **DNA** annotations in `GATE XML format <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/splitch5.html#x8-1000005.5.2>`_ * **RNA** annotations in `GATE XML format <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/splitch5.html#x8-1000005.5.2>`_ * **CellLine** annotations in `GATE XML format <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/splitch5.html#x8-1000005.5.2>`_ * **CellType** annotations in `GATE XML format <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/splitch5.html#x8-1000005.5.2>`_
.. class:: warningmark
The output of all GATE tools is in the `GATE XML format <https://gate.ac.uk/sale/tao/splitch5.html#x8-1000005.5.2>`_. This output can be input directly into other GATE tools. To input GATE XML format to tools requiring LIF, use *Convert formats->GateToLif*
**License**
This tool is adapted from the `General Architecture for Text Engineering (GATE) platform <http:gate.ac.uk>`_, which is released under the `GNU Lesser General Public License 3.0 <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl-3.0.html>`_
